title: Statistics Quiz: Descriptive Analytics
description: Test your understanding of descriptive statistics concepts

questions.question: What does the mean represent in a dataset?
options: The middle value when data is sorted
The difference between highest and lowest values
questions.explanation: The mean is the average of all values in a dataset, calculated by summing all values and dividing by the count of values.

questions.question: Which measure of central tendency is least affected by outliers?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle value and is not affected by extreme outliers, unlike the mean which can be significantly skewed by outliers.

questions.question: What does standard deviation measure?
options: The middle value of a dataset
The most common value in a dataset
The spread or variability of data around the mean
The total number of data points
questions.explanation: Standard deviation measures how spread out the data points are from the mean. A low standard deviation means data points are close to the mean, while a high standard deviation indicates more spread.

questions.question: True or False: The mode is always unique in a dataset
questions.explanation: False. A dataset can have multiple modes (bimodal, multimodal) if multiple values occur with the same highest frequency, or no mode if all values occur with equal frequency.

questions.question: In a normal distribution, approximately what percentage of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean?
questions.explanation: In a normal distribution, approximately 68% of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean. This is part of the 68-95-99.7 rule (empirical rule).

questions.question: What is the interquartile range (IQR)?
options: The difference between the maximum and minimum values
The difference between the 75th and 25th percentiles
Both B and C are correct
questions.explanation: The IQR is the difference between the 75th percentile (Q3) and 25th percentile (Q1), which represents the middle 50% of the data and is useful for identifying outliers.
